articles.title: KPA Service Personnel Meet to Vow Their Pledge
articles.content:
KPA Service Personnel Meet to Vow Their Pledge
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army held a meeting to vow their pledge "Pledge of faith of young vanguard to uphold the Songun cause of Mt. Paektu with arms" before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on Wednesday on the occasion of the Youth Day.
					 Present there were KPA General Hyon Yong Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, officials of the ministry, service personnel of the Ground, Naval and Air and Anti-Air Forces, cadets of military academies at various levels and students of revolutionary schools.
					
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them in the humblest reverence.
					
					 Om Hyang Chol, chairman of the KPA committee of the youth league, made a speech at the meeting.
					
					 The hearts of the young vanguard tightly holding the arms of Mt. Paektu are filled with profound reverence for the President and Kim Jong Il who worked heart and soul to develop the Korean youth movement, he said.
					
					 He stressed the need for all service personnel to invariably preserve the President's and Kim Jong Il's idea of the youth movement and their feats, glorify them eternally and bring earlier the reunification of the country and the final victory in the drive for the building of a thriving nation true to the Songun leadership of respected Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 There took place a dancing party of KPA service personnel to celebrate the Youth Day.

articles.title: Members of Young Vanguard Meet to Vow Their Pledge
articles.content:
Members of Young Vanguard Meet 
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting and grand march of members of the young vanguard took place at the Kim Il Sung Stadium Wednesday to dynamically advance under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Thae Bok and Choe Ryong Hae and other officials concerned, those of the youth league, youth and students and members of youth shock brigade.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league, made a report at the meeting to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that President Kim Il Sung, basing himself on the scientific penetration into the position and role of the young people in the revolutionary movement and the socio-historic development, put forward them as the most viable unit of the society and led the Juche-based youth movement to victory.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il, remaining true to the idea of the President on attaching importance to youth, developed the youth league into the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and an eternal companion of the WPK, they noted.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, remaining loyal to the idea and cause of the President and Kim Jong Il, sent his autographs and congratulatory messages reflecting his profound trust and loving care to the young people, providing the militant banner to be held fast to  by the young Korean people and the youth league, they pointed out.
					
					 They called for giving fullest play to the heroic spirit and militant stamina of the Songun young vanguard and dynamically struggle for the final victory of the building of a thriving socialist nation, along the road indicated by the WPK, united closer around Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The meeting was followed by a grand march of members of the young vanguard.
					
					 They were warmly welcomed by citizens.

articles.title: U.S. Can Never Evade Its Responsibility for Escalated Tension on Korean Peninsula: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Can Never Evade Its Responsibility for Escalated Tension on Korean Peninsula: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- U.S. State Secretary Kerry said at a recent international meeting that the nukes and missiles of north Korea pose a threat to the Asia-Pacific region, adding north Korea should keep its promise to make verifiable peaceful denuclearization.
					 He also talked rubbish that the U.S. wants only the peace on the Korean peninsula, it has no intent to be hostile to north Korea, it seeks improved relations with north Korea, but it is possible only when north Korea shows its will to fulfill its commitments.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in an article in this regard:
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the U.S. to justify its hostile policy towards the DPRK and stifle it by force of arms without fail after branding it as a "disturber of peace" at any cost.
					
					 The article cites concrete facts to prove that the U.S. set its goal to bring down the social system chosen by the Korean people themselves after defining the DPRK as enemy from the moment of its foundation and has perpetrated the moves to antagonize it.
					
					 It continues:
					
					 Such harsh hostile moves pursued by the U.S. against the DPRK for the last several decades are unethical and state-sponsored terrorism unprecedented in history.
					
					 The U.S. has never wanted improved relations with the DPRK but worked hard to overthrow it by force of arms, waiting for a chance through procrastination.
					
					 What Kerry uttered about improved DPRK-U.S. relations, the peace on the Korean peninsula and the like is nothing but a clumsy and poor wordplay and mockery and insult to the Korean people desirous of the genuine peace on the peninsula.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. evade its responsibility for the tensions on the peninsula.

articles.title: Watches Bearing August Name of Kim Jong Il Awarded to Creators, Artistes
articles.content:
Watches Bearing August Name of Kim Jong Il Awarded to Creators, Artistes
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Watches bearing the august name of leader Kim Jong Il were awarded to creators and artistes who successfully created and depicted the song "Sea of Apples at Foot of Chol Pass" as the masterpiece of the era and made contributions to ushering in a new heyday of the development of the Juche-oriented music art.
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un highly estimated the song as the most successful masterpiece and showed deepest trust and greatest loving care for creators and artistes of the Moranbong Band, seeing to it that the watches bearing the august name of Kim Jong Il were awarded to them as citations.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Pyongyang Grand Theater Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, officials concerned and officials, creators, artistes, teachers and researchers in the fields of literature and arts and art education. 
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, made an address on awarding the watches.
					
					 He called upon all the creators and artistes to bear in mind the warm benevolence to be conveyed long generation after generation, remain true to the party's Songun leadership through the creation of lots of masterpieces and glorify the new era of the Juche revolution as the heyday of the development of literature and arts. 
					
					 The watches were awarded to writer of the creative room of the Moranbong Band Cha Ho Gun, its composer An Jong Ho, its singer Kim Sol Mi and its recordist Kil Won Gum.

articles.title: Women's Union Officials Hold Seminar
articles.content:
Women's Union Officials Hold Seminar
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Officials of the women's union held a seminar at the Hall of Women Wednesday on the education in Kim Jong Il's patriotism, faith, working class viewpoint and morality.
					 Present there were officials concerned and officials of the women's union.
					
					 The participants heard papers dealing with the significance and validity of the idea clarified by Marshal Kim Jong Un on the education in Kim Jong Il's patriotism, faith, working class viewpoint and morality and the issues arising in the ideological education among the women's union members.
					
					 Speakers said that the idea advanced by Kim Jong Un serves as important guidelines indicating the most correct way for the women's union to bring about a new turn in the ideological education as required by the developing reality and prepare the women as powerful forces pushing ahead with the revolution and construction.
					
					 They stressed the need to firmly arm themselves with the idea and theory of the 4-point education clarified by Kim Jong Un, consistently hold fast to them and thus more firmly build up the women's union into the Songun revolutionary organization remaining most loyal to the idea and leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The advisor to the minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia and his party and a delegation of the Union of Korean Students in Japan visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Wednesday.
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Italian Delegation of Lawmakers Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Italian Delegation of Lawmakers Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of lawmakers from various political parties of Italy led by Antonio Razzi, secretary general of the Commission for Foreign Affairs of the Senate who is chairman of the Italia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Wednesday.
					 The guests paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They paid homage to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who lie in state in humble reverence.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The head of the delegation made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Mongolian Guests Arrive
articles.content:
Mongolian Guests Arrive
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- O. Mashbat, advisor to the minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, and his party arrived here Wednesday.

articles.title: Delegation of Cuban Foreign Ministry Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Cuban Foreign Ministry Leaves
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Cuban Ministry of Foreign Affairs headed by Director General for Bilateral Affairs Gerardo Penalver Portal left here for home Wednesday.

articles.title: Delegation of Cuban Foreign Ministry Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of Cuban Foreign Ministry Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Cuban Ministry of Foreign Affairs headed by Director General for Bilateral Affairs Gerardo Penalver Portal visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the undying revolutionary life of the President who devoted his all to the prosperity of the country, happiness of the people and the accomplishment of the human cause of independence, the guests looked round the historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae.
					
					 The head of the delegation said that he was deeply moved to visit Mangyongdae, adding that the President, who was born in a simple and patriotic family and grew up to be the great revolutionary, liberated Korea and built the powerful socialist nation on this land.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum. After the visit the head of the delegation wrote in the visitor's book:
					
					 The museum is an important place helping the rising generation who did not experience the war know about the history of the victory won in the war by the preceding generation of the revolution. Independent and prospering socialist Korea could be built thanks to the heroic self-sacrificing spirit of the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 The guests toured the Museum of Weapons and Equipment of the Korean People's Army and the Revolutionary Museum of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Siberian and Far East Regions of Russia Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Siberian and Far East Regions of Russia Marked
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Wednesday to mark the third anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's historic visit to the Siberian and Far East Regions of the Russian Federation.
					 Present there on invitation were Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin and his embassy officials.
					
					 Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned, teachers and students of DPRK-Russia Friendship Moranbong Secondary School No. 1 were present.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting. 
					
					 The participants enjoyed a performance given by the art group of students of the school.
					
					 Earlier, embassy officials toured the Central Mushroom Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences.

articles.title: Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Fishery in Area of West Sea Held
articles.content:
Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Fishery in Area of West Sea Held
 Nampho, August 27 (KCNA) -- The scientific and technological presentation in the field of fishery in the area of the West Sea of Korea took place in the West Sea Fishery Research Institute of the Branch Academy of Fishery of the State Academy of Sciences on Tuesday and Wednesday.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians, teachers and officials of production units and scientific and educational institutions in the field of fishery.
					
					 Submitted to the presentation were more than 40 papers showing the research successes made in updating fishing boats and fishing tackles and putting technology of scientific search for fishing ground, fishing technology, cultivation and processing fields onto a high stage.
					
					 The participants introduced achievements and experience made by them in solving the scientific and technological issues arising in increasing the aquatic production, true to the militant task of the Workers' Party of Korea to boost the fishing industry of the country by learning from the example set by the fishing sector of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Prizes were awarded to the participants who presented excellent papers.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestler Bag Gold Medal at Youth Olympic Games
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestler Bag Gold Medal at Youth Olympic Games
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK wrestler Kim Son Hyang bagged a gold medal in the women's free-style wrestling 46 kg category at the 2nd Youth Olympic Games on August 26. 
					 Kim trounced her New Zealand rival 4:0 and her Moldovan rival 3:1. In the finals she defeated her Mongolian rival 3:1.

articles.title: Beach Volleyball Popular in DPRK
articles.content:
Beach Volleyball Popular in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Beach volleyball is enjoying great popularity among citizens in the DPRK.
					 Such volleyball courts can be seen not only on beaches but also in cities and inland and mountainous areas of the country.
					
					 Kim Chung Gwan, chairman of the Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang, People's Committee, told KCNA when he was interviewed at the beach volleyball court built in the district:
					
					 From olden times the Koreans have enjoyed sports very much.
					
					 It is now a trend in the country to build beach volleyball courts in wading pools after the emergence of the Rungna Wading Pool two years ago.
					
					So, we recently built a beach volleyball court in a park of the district, with 100 tons of sand brought from beaches, to meet the inhabitants' growing demand for it.
					
					 At present the park is crowded every day with inhabitants playing beach volleyball and other sports events.

articles.title: High-purity Aluminum Production Process Established
articles.content:
High-purity Aluminum Production Process Established
						
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A high-purity aluminum production process has been established at the Pyongyang Electric Cable Factory 326 in the DPRK.
					 The process is for extracting high-purity aluminum from such waste materials as oxidized aluminum electric wires. It was developed by researchers of the Metal Engineering Faculty of Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					 This new process helps produce 99.9 percent aluminum with less consumption of electricity, while reducing environmental pollution.

articles.title: Show of Paintings Drawn by DPRK, Japanese Children
articles.content:
Show of Paintings Drawn by DPRK, Japanese Children
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A show of paintings drawn by children of the DPRK and Japan took place at Rungna Primary School in Taedonggang District, Pyongyang, on August 25-26.
					 Present at the show were Hwang Ho Nam, vice-chairman of the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned, teachers and pupils and their parents of the school, Japan-resident Korean children and a Japanese delegation for the show led by Shinji Yoneda, director of the Japan Federation for UNESCO.
					
					 On display at the show were more than 100 paintings presented by DPRK schoolchildren, pupils of Korean primary schools in Japan and Japanese children, which represent dreams and ideals of the children in the two countries and their mental world.
					
					 What drew visitors' eyes in particular are "Peaceful World" drawn by Kim Hyo Yon, a Korean child, and a painting by Yuga Sugimoto, a Japanese child, which shows children of the two countries playing merrily in the beautiful nature hand in hand with each other.
					
					 There are also "Peace Area Enjoying Rich Harvest" reflecting the Korean and Japanese children's dreams in the future and other paintings that represent a child's mind to tour historical sites in a reunified country as well as children's hope for free travel to Korea and Japan by ship "Arirang".
					
					 Yukiko Tsutsui, general secretary of the Korea Children Campaign, told KCNA:
					
					 Those paintings, presented by the Japanese side, had won great popularity at the exhibitions in Tokyo and other parts of Japan, and they are our treasures.
					
					 The show made us feel the excellent drawing skills of the DPRK pupils. I hope that the two countries would be on good terms with each other.
					
					 Shinji Yoneda said Japan and the DPRK have a bright prospect for normalization of their relations at present, expressing belief that the show would play a role adding brilliance to the prospect.
					
					 He hoped that the show would be recalled as a significant event in the turning point for improved relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Tudan Duck Farm in DPRK
articles.content:
Tudan Duck Farm in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- In Rangnang District of Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK, there is an islet called Tudan, which turned into a duck farm on August 27, 1954.
					 The Tudan Duck Farm, with an area of 134 000 square meters, has a base for production of animal protein feed, a duck smokehouse, production processes for organic compound fertilizer and methane gas and many other buildings.
					
					 The history of its development into a leading poultry farm of the country is associated with the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's warm love for the people and their devoted efforts.
					
					 Kim Il Sung had always paid deep attention to the development of the nation's poultry farming after Korea's liberation from Japan's colonial rule.
					
					In the days of the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War he took a measure to carry home breed duck eggs by air. After the war, he spared nothing for the construction of the duck farm and for its normal operation, personally providing it with breed duck eggs.
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his lifetime frequently visited the farm to indicate in detail the ways for its management and operation and took a state measure to remodel the farm.
					
					 In Juche 100 (2011), the last year of his great life, he gave important instructions for the updating of the farm on more than 10 occasions.

articles.title: Halt to UFG Demanded by Japanese
articles.content:
Halt to UFG Demanded by Japanese
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Japanese public figures issued statements on August 22 and 23 denouncing the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces for kicking off Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises.
					 Hideaki Kohiyama, secretary general of the Hokkaido Citizens' Council for Japan-Korea Solidarity, said:
					
					 UFG disturbing the peace on the Korean peninsula and in its vicinity and seeking a nuclear war should be halted at once.
					
					 The joint military exercises being staged in south Korea after the U.S. announcement of its new defense strategy are assuming more aggressive nature in their contents, and their scale and number are steadily increasing.
					
					 The U.S. announced that it would apply for the first time during UFG the "strategy" which calls for making a preemptive strike by mobilizing all forms of armed forces including nuclear weapons if "signs of the use of nukes and missiles" by someone are detected. This is an undisguised nuclear threat.
					
					 What is required now is to defuse military tensions on the Korean peninsula to secure the peace and stability in East Asia and replace the Korean Armistice Agreement with a peace one.
					
					 Akiyoshi Takanashi, secretary general of the Kanagawa Prefectural Citizen's Society for Promoting the Normalization of Japan-DPRK Diplomatic Relations, noted:
					
					 We wanting to see the peace and stability on the Korean peninsula can never overlook the military drills to ignite a war but strongly demand an immediate stop to them.
					
					 As the respect for the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK and reunification of Korea are required for the peace and stability on the Korean peninsula, the criminal nature of the joint military exercises aimed to bring down the social system of the DPRK should not be overlooked even a bit.
					
					 We demand an immediate halt to the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.

articles.title: Tablet to Honor Kim Jong Il Unveiled in Russia
articles.content:
Tablet to Honor Kim Jong Il Unveiled in Russia
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A tablet to honor leader Kim Jong Il was unveiled at Bureya Railway Station in Amur Region, Russia.
					 The tablet reads: "Comrade Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, visited Bureya Railway Station on Aug. 21, 2011."
					
					 An unveiling ceremony took place on the spot on Aug. 21. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were personages of different social standings and other masses in Amur Region and the vice consul general and consuls of the DPRK in Khabarovsk. 
					
					 The stationmaster of Bureya Railway Station and the vice consul general of the DPRK unveiled the tablet. 
					
					 A floral basket, bouquets and flowers were laid before it. 
					
					 The stationmaster said:
					
					 It is great pleasure and honor to unveil the tablet to honor Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the third anniversary of his historic visit to the Siberian and Far Eastern regions of the Russian Federation. 
					
					 Three years ago I was fortunate to receive Comrade Kim Jong Il when he was visiting Bureya Railway Station. 
					
					 It is our hope that we will be able to welcome supreme leader of the Korean people Comrade Kim Jong Un to Bureya Railway Station without fail. 
					
					 The general director of a company said that having the tablet to honor Kim Jong Il at the station is a reflection of boundless reverence of the people in Amur Region for him and it is symbolic of Russia-DPRK friendship.

articles.title: Institution of Special Law on Ferry Sewol Disaster Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Institution of Special Law on Ferry Sewol Disaster Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Bereaved families of the ferry Sewol disaster and people from various circles of south Korea held a rally at the Kwanghwamun Plaza, Seoul on Aug. 23 in demand of the institution of a special law on probing the truth behind the disaster.
					 Speakers at the rally accused Chongwadae of refusing to lend an ear to the voices of people calling for reflecting the demands of the bereaved families in s special law on the ferry Sewol disaster.
					
					 To institute a special law on investing the fact-finding committee with the right to investigate and indict those responsible for it is the demand of not only the bereaved families but also all people, they stressed.
					
					 Then, they staged a demonstration toward the scene near Chongwadae where bereaved families were staging a sit-in strike in demand of an interview with the chief executive.
					
					 When policemen blocked their way, indiscriminately suppressing them, the demonstrators launched a sit-in strike in protest against their crackdown.
					
					 Meanwhile, the puppet police hurled a lot of vehicles and troops into encircling the venue of the bereaved families' sit-in strike to prevent citizens of various circles from joining the protestors.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Government Accused of Its Incompetence
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Government Accused of Its Incompetence
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea, in an editorial on August 25 accused the puppet ruling forces of their incompetence.
					 The editorial recalled that the chief executive recently set forth tasks for social reform as regards the ferry Sewol disaster but none of them related to the disaster have been carried out.
					
					 This is because the "government" does not intend to properly clarify the cause of the accident and, therefore, it is not accepting the special bill proposed by the bereaved families, it said.
					
					 It accused the "government" of trying to reform the society with such a way of thinking that there can be neither investigation nor indictment with civilians involved.
					
					 It urged the chief executive to reform herself, instead of remaking society, and lend her ear to the voices of the bereaved families and the people, to begin with.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Ruling Forces Assailed for Twisting Nature of Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Ruling Forces Assailed for Twisting Nature of Disaster
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, an internet paper of south Korea, in an article on August 24 denounced the puppet conservative ruling forces for twisting the nature of the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The article recalled that the chief executive talked about a thorough-going investigation and punishment of those responsible for the disaster, with tears in her eyes after the accident occurred but is working hard to evade the blame for it nowadays, leaving everything to the "National Assembly."
					
					 The ruling and opposition parties are threatening the people with an ineffective and unrealistic agreement, paying no heed to the voices of the bereaved families, it noted.
					
					 Some media together with the "government" are labeling the victims as assailants, police and the Intelligence Service are watching the bereaved families and conservative forces are threatening them by branding them as "followers of the north", it charged.
					
					 Only when those responsible for the disaster are severely punished, can the grudge of the bereaved families be settled, it noted.

articles.title: S. Korea Hit by Torrential Rain
articles.content:
S. Korea Hit by Torrential Rain
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The areas of Pusan and Changwon of South Kyongsang Province, south Korea were hit by torrential rain over 100 mm per hour on August 25, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 It left several people dead in Pusan. Houses collapsed, railway service was suspended and power station stopped its operation.
					
					 Water swollen by strong downpour in Jindong-myon, Changwon City, South Kyongsang Province swept away a bus, leaving a woman dead and several persons missing.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work off Press in Russia
articles.content:
S. Korea Hit by Torrential Rain
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The areas of Pusan and Changwon of South Kyongsang Province, south Korea were hit by torrential rain over 100 mm per hour on August 25, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 It left several people dead in Pusan. Houses collapsed, railway service was suspended and power station stopped its operation.
					
					 Water swollen by strong downpour in Jindong-myon, Changwon City, South Kyongsang Province swept away a bus, leaving a woman dead and several persons missing.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked in Tajikistan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work off Press in Russia
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" was brought out in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on August 19.
					 The work, published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), deals with the Songun revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il and the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and clarifies tasks to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked in Tajikistan 
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, made public a statement on August 21 on the occasion of the Day of Songun. 
					 Noting that Aug. 25 is the significant day marking the 54th anniversary of the great leader of the Korean people Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership, the statement went on:
					
					 He firmly defended the socialist system in the DPRK with the Songun revolutionary leadership based on the idea of attaching importance to the army and the military affairs. 
					
					 At the end of the last century the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces conducted a general offensive in all fields including politics, military affairs, economy, culture and diplomacy to deter the DPRK steadily advancing along the road of socialism under the uplifted banner of independence against imperialism. 
					
					 To cope with this he held higher the banner of Songun and formulated the Songun politics as a main political mode under socialism. 
					
					 Thanks to his Songun politics the defence capability of the DPRK has been remarkably bolstered up and the DPRK turned into a military power which no formidable enemy dares provoke. 
					
					 Sovereignty and socialism of the DPRK have been protected and peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia have been guaranteed. 
					
					 It is a trend of the times to learn from the Songun politics at present.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are now bringing about fresh miracles and innovations every day in the building of a thriving nation, united close around supreme leader Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Songun Korea will surely win the final victory.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition was held in Russia, meeting and film show in Benin, photo exhibition and film show in Nigeria and round-table talks in Ethiopia between August 17 and 27 on the occasion of the Day of Songun.
					 Displayed there were photos documenting feats performed by President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display were works of the peerless great persons of Mt. Paektu, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the wisdom and talents of Koreans.
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "Arms of Korea".
					
					 Present at the events were people of all social standings of relevant countries.
					
					 A vice administrative governor of a district of Moscow City and other speakers said that the DPRK has turned into a powerful socialist country capable of beating back the aggression by any formidable enemy thanks to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The president of the Socialist Party of Benin noted that the eye-opening reality of the DPRK which is dynamically advancing along the road of prosperity is a brilliant fruition of the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria praised the undying Songun leadership feats performed by Kim Jong Il, recalling that he started his Songun revolutionary leadership on August 25, 1960.
					
					 A vice director of a hospital of Ethiopia praised Kim Jong Il as the distinguished statesman who considered military affairs as the most important state affairs and firmly defended socialism.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event in Benin.

articles.title: British Organizations Praise Struggle of Fighters of AINDF
articles.content:
British Organizations Praise Struggle of Fighters of AINDF
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on August 22 on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the founding of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF) in south Korea.
					 The statement said:
					
					 August 25 marks the 45th anniversary of the founding of the Revolutionary Party for Reunification, the predecessor of the AINDF.
					
					 The party and AINDF waged a strenuous struggle against imperialism and fascism despite the fascist suppression by the south Korean puppet clique over the past 45 years.
					
					 Kim Jong Thae and Choe Yong Do, leading members of the party, were ruthlessly killed by the south Korean puppet fascist authorities but they are always remembered as the fighters who dedicated their lives to the south Korean revolution and the reunification of the country.
					
					 The fighters of AINDF are now valiantly struggling for the independent reunification of the country against the U.S. imperialists' presence in south Korea and neo-colonial system, holding in high esteem respected Marshal Kim Jong Un as the lodestar of national reunification.
					
					 We are proud of having such excellent comrades as the fighters of AINDF and convinced that they will certainly win the final victory.

articles.title: Nigerian Organization Urges U.S. to Roll back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Nigerian Organization Urges U.S. to Roll back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article titled "U.S. hostile policy toward DPRK" on its website on Aug. 15.
					 The article noted:
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK has its deep roots.
					
					 The U.S. has enforced the hostile policy since quite a long time before the nuclear issue was spawned on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 From the very beginning, Washington defined the DPRK as an enemy state and has never recognized its sovereignty.
					
					 The modern history never knows such countries as the DPRK and the U.S. which have been technically at war for over 60 years since the end of the Korean war.
					
					 The U.S. stand cannot be construed otherwise than its intention to continue regarding the DPRK as a warring party and an enemy.
					
					 The U.S. has already rounded off different type scenarios for a new Korean war.
					
					 Pursuant to the scenarios, the U.S. has annually staged various type joint war drills under different codenames for decades.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy is not confined to these drills.
					
					 The U.S. has slapped harsh economic sanctions and blockade against the DPRK since a long time before the occurrence of the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Furthermore, the U.S. has not spared its funds and investment for espionage aimed to bring down the social system in the DPRK, ideological and cultural poisoning against it and operations for destabilizing it since long ago.
					
					 Historical facts go to clearly prove that the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK was not spawned due to the latter's access to nukes but the former compelled the latter to have access to nukes.
					
					 Needless to say, the U.S. should roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK to settle the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula as the policy spawned the issue.

articles.title: Tienen lugar acto y marcha de juramento de vanguardias juveniles
articles.content:
Tienen lugar acto y marcha de juramento de vanguardias juveniles
 Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 27 en el Estadio Kim Il Sung el acto y la marcha de juramento de vanguardias juveniles para avanzar a pasos firmes siguiendo siempre al Partido del Trabajo de Corea en pleno acato a la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun.
					 En la ocasion participaron Kim Yong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae y los funcionarios de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, los estudiantes y los miembros de brigada de choque juvenil.
					
					 El informe de ocasion estuvo a cargo de Jon Yong Nam, presidente del CC de la UJS y hubo intervenciones.
					
					 Los oradores recordaron que el Presidente Kim Il Sung presento a los jovenes como destacamento mas vigoroso de la sociedad y condujo a la victoria el movimiento juvenil del Juche percatandose cientificamente de la posicion y el papel de los jovenes en el movimiento revolucionario y en el desarrollo social e historico. 
					
					 Subrayaron que en acato a la idea del Presidente de dar importancia a la juventud, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il fortalecio la union de la juventud como la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung y el eterno acompanante del PTC.
					
					 Enfatizaron que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, quien apoya con fidelidad la idea y la causa de los grandes hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu, envio a los jovenes autografos y mensajes de felicitacion y preparo la bandera combativa a ser tomada por los jovenes coreanos y la UJS.
					
					 Destacaron que todos los jovenes coreanos, unidos compactamente en torno al Mariscal, deben poner de pleno manifiesto el espiritu heroico e impetu combativo de vanguardias juveniles del Songun y avanzar a pasos firmes por el camino indicado por el partido hacia la victoria final de la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista.
					
					 Terminado el acto, se desarrollo la marcha de juramento de vanguardias juveniles.
					
					 Los ciudadanos transeuntes les dieron calurosas bienvenidas.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto de juramento de militares
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto de juramento de militares 
 Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia de la Juventud (28 de agosto), tuvo lugar el dia 27 ante las estatuas de bronce de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il erguidas en el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares el acto de juramento de los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea "Juramento de conviccion de vanguardistas juveniles de apoyar con armas la causa del Songun del Paektu". 
					 Participaron el general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del EPC Hyon Yong Chol, ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, los funcionarios del MINFAP, los oficiales y soldados de las fuerzas terrestres, navales, aereas y antiaereas, y los cadetes de academias militares a todos los niveles y alumnos de escuelas revolucionarias. 
					
					 Ante todo, los participantes rindieron el sublime homenaje a los Generalisimos tras colocar cestos y ramos de flores ante sus estatuas de bronce. 
					
					 En la ocasion, hizo uso de la palabra el presidente de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung en el EPC, Om Hyang Chol.
					
					 El orador dijo que los vanguardistas juveniles en servicio militar estan llenos de gran veneracion hacia los Generalisimos que hicieron  ingentes esfuerzos mentales y fisicos por el desarrollo del movimiento juvenil coreano. 
					
					 Llamaron a todos los militares a mantener y glorificar invariablemente la idea y las hazanas de los Generalisimos en materia del movimiento juvenil y apoyar con fidelidad la guia del Songun del Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un para adelantar la reunificacion de la patria y la victoria final de la construccion de un Estado prospero. 
					
					 Hubo discursos de decision. 
					
					 Durante el acto se oyeron la narracion y el gran coro "Marcha de los jovenes coreanos", el duo femenino y panchang "Cojin dorado", la poesia en dialogo "Bendicion de amor", el cuarteto mixto y pangchag "No podemos vivir sin el", la poesia de juramento "Lograremos la victoria final de la revolucion siguiendo al Mariscal" y otros y hubo el baile de los militares en celebracion del Dia de la Juventud.

articles.title: Se otorga reloj con nombre de Kim Jong Il a creadores y artistas
articles.content:
Se otorga reloj con nombre de Kim Jong Il a creadores y artistas
 Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- Fue otorgado el reloj con el nombre del Dirigente Kim Jong Il a los creadores y artistas quienes hicieron aporte a abrir una nueva era dorada del desarrollo de musica y arte del Juche creando y describiendo magnificamente la cancion "Mar de manzanas al pie del monte Chol" como una obra maestra de la epoca.
					 El Mariscal Kim Jong Un evaluo altamente la cancion como una obra maestra e hizo con gran confianza y amor otorgar a los creadores y artistas de la Banda Moranbong el reloj con el nombre del Dirigente.
					
					 La ceremonia de otorgamiento tuvo lugar el dia 27 en el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang.
					
					 En la ocasion participaron Kim Ki Nam y otros cuadros, funcionarios, creadores, artistas, profesores e investigadores de ramas de literatura, arte y educacion artistica incluyendo la Banda Moranbong.
					
					 El discurso de otorgamiento estuvo a cargo del miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam.
					
					 El senalo que todos los creadores y artistas deben apoyar la direccion del Songun del partido mediante la creacion de muchas obras maestras y acelerar la lucha por hacer brillar la nueva epoca de la revolucion del Juche como la era dorada del desarrollo de literatura y arte guardando profundamente el ardiente amor dispensado por el Mariscal
					
					 Fue otorgado el reloj con el nombre de Kim Jong Il al escritor y el compositor de la sala de creacion Cha Ho Gun y An Jong Ho, la cantante Kim Sol Mi y el grabador Kil Won Gum, de la Banda Moranbong, respectivamente.

articles.title: EE.UU. no puede liberarse de responsabilidad de situacion tensa, insiste Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
EE.UU. no puede liberarse de responsabilidad de situacion tensa, insiste Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- El secretario de Estado norteamericano, Kerry, en una reunion internacional dijo que "las armas nucleares y los misiles del Norte de Corea sirven de una amenaza a la region del Asia-Pacifico" y "este debe cumplir la promesa de  lograr por via pacifica la desnuclearizacion verificable". Agrego que su pais desea la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, no tiene voluntad de hostilizar el Norte de Corea y persigue la mejora de relaciones con esta, pero todo esto es posible cuando el Norte de Corea muestre la voluntad de ejecutar su obligacion.
					 El diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este miercoles senala que el intento de EE.UU. es justificar la politica  hostil anti-RPDC y aplastarla a toda costa con las fuerzas militares tildandola de "destructora de la paz".
					
					 Despues de fundada la RPDC, EE.UU. la definio como su enemigo y perpetro las maquinaciones hostiles a la RPDC para derrotar el regimen optado por el pueblo coreano.
					
					 El imperio las continua de siglo en siglo, los cuales son los actos antieticos y terroristas estatales nunca vistos en la historia.
					
					 El imperio no desea ni un minimo la mejora de las relaciones con la RPDC e intenta derribarla con el metodo militar cuanto tenga la oportunidad.
					
					 EE.UU. habla de la mejora de  relaciones con la RPDC y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, lo cual es la burla e insulto al pueblo coreano que desea la verdadera paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					 Aunque EE.UU. actua astutamente no puede liberarse de la responsabilidad de empeoramiento de la situacion de esta Peninsula.
